description.value:
Skr’a S’orsk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage in crocodile form. If Skr’a S’orsk is in crocodile form and the target is a Large or smaller creature, the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}, and Skr’a S’orsk can’t bite another target. If Skr’a S’orsk reverts to its true form, the grapple ends.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Skr’a S’orsk magically polymorphs into a crocodile, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
Hold Breath. Skr’a S’orsk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spellcasting (Lizardfolk Form Only). Skr’a S’orsk is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). Skr’a S’orsk has the following druid spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): produce flame, resistance, thorn whip

1st level (4 slots): entangle, fog cloud

2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, spike growth

3rd level (2 slots): animate dead, conjure animals (reptiles only)

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the saving throw. The spell then ends.

Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a &Reference[str]{Strength} check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

changes.value: You can take an action to break free by rolling a Strength Ability Check
turn=end, rollType=check, actionSave=true, saveAbility=str, saveDC=@attributes.spelldc, label=Restrained by Entangle

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. If it fails, the target is either &Reference[blinded]{blinded} or &Reference[deafened]{deafened} (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

macro.name: Blindness/Deafness

description.value:
The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes &Reference[difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

materials.value: seven sharp thorns or seven small twigs, each sharpened to a point

description.value:
This spell creates an &Reference[undead]{undead} servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an &Reference[undead]{undead} creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional &Reference[undead]{undead} creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

materials.value: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

description.value:
Special Notes: reptiles only.

You summon &Reference[fey]{fey} spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

  • One &Reference[beast]{beast} of challenge rating 2 or lower
  • Two beasts of challenge rating 1 or lower
  • Four beasts of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
  • Eight beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower

Each &Reference[beast]{beast} is also considered &Reference[fey]{fey}, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

The GM has the creatures' statistics. Sample creatures can be found below.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

Sample Creatures

CR Creature Name
0 Frog, Sea Horse, Baboon, Badger, Bat, Cat, Crab, Deer, Eagle, &Reference[giant]{Giant} &Reference[fire]{Fire} Beetle, Goat, Hawk, Hyena, Jackal, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Quipper, Rat, Raven, Scorpion, Spider, Vulture, Weasel
1/8 Blood Hawk, Camel, Flying Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Crab, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Rat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Weasel, Mastiff, Mule, Poisonous Snake, Pony, Stirge
1/4 Axe Beak, Boar, Constrictor Snake, Draft Horse, Elk, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Badger, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Bat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Centipede, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Frog, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Lizard, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Owl, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Poisonous Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Wolf Spider, Panther, Riding Horse, Wolf
1/2 Ape, Black Bear, Crocodile, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Goat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Sea Horse, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Wasp, Reef Shark, Warhorse
1 Brown Bear, Dire Wolf, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Eagle, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Hyena, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Octopus, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Spider, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Toad, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Vulture, Lion, Tiger
2 &Reference[giant]{Giant} Boar, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Constrictor Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Elk, Hunter Shark, Plesiosaurus, Polar Bear, Rhinoceros, Saber-toothed Tiger
